me.lihq.game

Class GameMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.Game
      • me.lihq.game.GameMain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public class GameMain
extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game
    This is the class responsible for the game as a whole. It manages the current states and entry points of the game

    • Method Detail

      • generateGame

        public void generateGame(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> traits,
                         java.lang.String playerCostume)
        The generate game screen generates the game. this is triggered by the completion of the CharacterCreationScreen. An array list of traits is passed in for the generation class to make use of.

      • create

        public void create()
        This is called at start up. It initialises the game.

      • getScreen

        public AbstractScreen getScreen()
        Overrides the getScreen method to return our AbstractScreen type. This means that we can access the additional methods like update.
        Overrides:
        getScreen in class com.badlogic.gdx.Game
        Returns:
        The current screen of the game.

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        This is the main gameLoop that only needs to be called once, it then creates a logic thread to be executed once a game tick
